articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from special envoy of Russian President 
    Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) --Kim Jong Il received a gift from the special envoy of the Russian President.
 The gift was handed on Saturday to an official concerned by A.P. Losyukov, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia, who is a special envoy of the Russian President on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK and Mongolian foreign ministers
articles.content:
DPRK officials meet special envoy of Russian President 
    Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, Secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and Jo Chang Dok, Vice-Premier of the DPRK Cabinet, today separately met and had a talk with A.P. Losyukov, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia, who is a special envoy of the Russian President.
 Present there were officials concerned, the party of the special envoy and Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Andrei Gennadievich Karlov

articles.title: Special envoy of Russian President feted
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK and Mongolian foreign ministers 
    Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Talks between Paek Nam Sun, DPRK Minister of Foreign Affairs, and Luvsangiin Erdenechuluun, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Mongolia, were held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 At the talks, the two sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting the friendly relations between the two countries and issues of mutual concern.    
 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were officials concerned and from the Mongolian side were the party of the Mongolian Foreign Minister and the Mongolian Ambassador to the DPRK Janchivdorjyn Lombo.

articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Algerian President
    Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il received a gift from Abdelaziz Bouteflika, President of Algeria, on the occasion of the New Year, Juche 92 (2003).
 It was handed to the DPRK Ambassador to China by the charge d'affaires ad interim of Algeria to China.

articles.title: Special envoy of Russian President here
articles.content:
Posters for 7th Kimjongilia Show created
    Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- New posters have been created for the 7th Kimjongilia Show to be held on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il (February 16).
 Inscribed in upper parts of them are slogans "Long Live General Kim Jong Il, Peerless Patriot" and "Long Live General Kim Jong Il, Legendary Hero" reflecting boundless reverence and praise and absolute trust in him of the Korean people and the world progressives and letters "February 16 Celebration".    
 Among them are a poster with Kimjongilia painted against Mt. Paektu and a poster with the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia exhibition and Kimjongilia.
 Written in lower parts of them are letters reading: the show is open at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia exhibition from February 12 to 21, Juche 92 (2003).

articles.title: Talks held between Kang Sok Ju and A. P. Losyukov
articles.content:
Special envoy of Russian President here
    Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- A. P. Losyukov, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia, in the capacity of a special envoy of the Russian President and his party arrived in Pyongyang on Saturday.
 They were met at the airport by Kung Sok Ung, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs, and other officials concerned, Andrei Gennadievich Karlov, Russian Ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of the embassy.

articles.title: 2003 declared as year of independence and peace
articles.content:
Talks held between Kang Sok Ju and A. P. Losyukov
    Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Talks were held here today between Kang Sok Ju, First Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, and A. P. Losyukov, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia, who is a special envoy of the Russian President.
 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting DPRK-Russia friendly relations that are daily developing on good terms under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries, the recent nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula and issues of concern related to the international situation.    
 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were officials concerned and from the Russian side were the party of the special envoy of the Russian President and the Russian Ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Mongolian Minister of Foreign Affairs arrives
articles.content:
2003 declared as year of independence and peace
    Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Representatives of 188 civic and public organizations including the All-People Measure Committee for Sin Hyo Sun and Sim Mi Son, Schoolgirls Killed By a U.S. Armored Car, the Citizen's Solidarity for Democratic  Society and the (South) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions reportedly called a press conference in Seoul on Jan. 13 on the occasion of the New Year and made public a press release.
 The release declared 2003 as a year of independence and peace, appealing to the people to make this year a year of punishing criminals responsible for the killings of girl students, a year of totally revising the unequal South Korea-U.S. Status of Forces Agreement, a year of settling the crisis of a war on the Korean Peninsula and bringing about a great turn in ensuring peace on the Korean Peninsula and other parts of Northeast Asia and a year of defending the global peace from a war and its threat in solidarity with the world peace-loving forces.    
 Saying that the U.S. hostile policy toward the north resulted in sparking confrontation between the north and the U.S., the press release clarified that they would hold an emergency meeting on the situation with delegates of different organizations attending and make public an emergency declaration on the situation. They also said that they would realize the U.S. visit of representatives of civic and public organizations, hold a grand candlelight march and a march for national independence and peace on the occasion of march 1 and steadily strengthen solidarity with international peace organizations.

articles.title: DPRK SPA delegation leaves
articles.content:
Mongolian Minister of Foreign Affairs arrives
    Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Luvsangiin Erdenechuluun, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Mongolia, and his party arrived here today.
 They were greeted at the airport by Kung Sok Ung, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs, and Janchivdorjyn Lombo, Mongolian Ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Special envoy of UN Secretary General leaves
articles.content:
DPRK SPA delegation leaves
    Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly led by vice-chairman Jang Chol left here today to participate in the international parliamentary meeting to be held in India.
 They were seen off at the airport by Jo Kyu Il, chairman of the Korea-India Friendship Parliamentary Group and deputy to the SPA, and Rich Pal Singh, Indian Ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il gives field guidance to land realignment project
articles.content:
Special envoy of UN Secretary General leaves
    Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Moris Strong, special envoy of the UN Secretary General, and his companion left here today after winding up his five-day Korea visit.
 They visited the Mansudae Art Studio and some aid projects of the World Food Programme during their stay in the DPRK.
